questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'scarce'?
questions.explanation: Scarce means in short supply; 'plentiful' is the direct opposite, meaning abundant.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'rigid'?
questions.explanation: Rigid means stiff or inflexible; 'flexible' is its opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'diminish'?
questions.explanation: Diminish means to make smaller; 'increase' means to make larger, the opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'hostile'?
questions.explanation: Hostile means unfriendly or aggressive; 'friendly' is the opposite attitude.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'reluctant'?
questions.explanation: Reluctant means unwilling; 'eager' means very willing or enthusiastic.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'expand'?
questions.explanation: Expand means to grow larger; 'shrink' means to become smaller.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'fragile'?
questions.explanation: Fragile means easily broken; 'strong' suggests durability and toughness.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'abundant'?
questions.explanation: Abundant means existing in large quantity; 'scarce' means in short supply.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'transparent'?
questions.explanation: Transparent means allowing light through clearly; 'opaque' means not letting light through.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'temporary'?
questions.explanation: Temporary means lasting for a short time; 'permanent' means lasting indefinitely.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'complex'?
questions.explanation: Complex means complicated; 'simple' means easy or not complicated.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'rigorous'?
questions.explanation: Rigorous means very strict or severe; 'mild' means gentle or not severe.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'cautious'?
questions.explanation: Cautious means careful to avoid risk; 'reckless' means ignoring risk.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'optimistic'?
questions.explanation: Optimistic means expecting good outcomes; 'pessimistic' means expecting bad ones.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'lenient'?
questions.explanation: Lenient means not strict; 'strict' means enforcing rules closely.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'innovative'?
questions.explanation: Innovative means introducing new ideas; 'traditional' means following old ways.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'expandable'?
questions.explanation: Expandable means able to be enlarged; 'fixed' means not changing or movable.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'cooperate'?
questions.explanation: Cooperate means work together; 'oppose' means work against.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'tolerant'?
questions.explanation: Tolerant means accepting of differences; 'intolerant' means not accepting them.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'vague'?
questions.explanation: Vague means unclear; 'specific' means clearly and precisely defined.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'durable'?
questions.explanation: Durable means long-lasting; 'fragile' means easily broken or damaged.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'accumulate'?
questions.explanation: Accumulate means gather together; 'disperse' means spread out or scatter.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'compulsory'?
questions.explanation: Compulsory means required; 'optional' means not required.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'artificial'?
questions.explanation: Artificial means man-made or not natural; 'natural' is the direct opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'exaggerate'?
questions.explanation: Exaggerate means overstate; 'minimize' means understate or make something seem smaller.
